data.text:
The bibliography section features citations to recently published works in all formats and covering all aspects of the history of anthropology. This page displays a comprehensive list of citations that we’ve collected since 2016 (going back as far as 2013); our recent batches and posts and a search tool are also available separately. You may also browse this list in Zotero.

We welcome suggestions from readers. If you come across something of interest during your own fieldwork in the library, whether that be physical or virtual, please let us know by emailing us at bibliographies@histanthro.org.

arch%20within%20overlapping%20disciplinary%20traditions.%20With%20this%20text%2C%20Greenberg%20presented%20a%20macro-level%20tripartite%20classification%20that%20opposed%20then%20dominant%20fine-grained%20analyses%20recognizing%20anywhere%20from%20150%20to%20200%20distinct%20language%20families.%20His%20proposal%20was%20the%20subject%20of%20a%20landmark%20conference%2C%20examining%20strengths%20and%20weaknesses%2C%20the%20unpublished%20proceedings%20of%20which%20are%20presented%20here%20for%20the%20first%20time.%20For%20specialists%20in%20the%20anthropological%20and%20comparative-historical%20study%20of%20Indigenous%20American%20languages%2C%20Greenberg%27s%20intervention%20highlighted%20the%20tension%20between%20language%2C%20conceived%20as%20an%20abstract%20object%20of%20study%2C%20and%20languages%2C%20understood%20to%20be%20carriers%20of%20specific%20cultural%20knowledge.%20For%20physical%20anthropologists%20and%20archaeologists%2C%20his%20theory%20was%20initially%20fortuitous%20on%20programmatic%2C%20substantive%2C%20and%20methodological%20grounds.%20The%20essay%20will%20show%20how%20interdisciplinary%20appeals%20were%20figured%20by%20supporters%20as%20a%20virtue%2C%20and%20by%20critics%20as%20a%20vice.%20The%20essay%20further%20highlights%20ethical%20reasons%20for%20integrating%20historical%20narratives%20of%20science%20and%20the%20humanities.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222023%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22doi.org%5C%2F10.1002%5C%2Fbewi.202200038%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%221522-2365%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi.org%5C%2F10.1002%5C%2Fbewi.202200038%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22KFGYJJFK%22%2C%2242Y4CVGJ%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222024-02-29T17%3A45%3A07Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%224XQXC8QC%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22lastModifiedByUser%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A3439166%2C%22username%22%3A%22janet.steins%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22%22%2C%22links%22%3A%7B%22alternate%22%3A%7B%22href%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fwww.zotero.org%5C%2Fjanet.steins%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22text%5C%2Fhtml%22%7D%7D%7D%2C%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Solleveld%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222023%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A1%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3ESolleveld%2C%20Floris.%20%5C%22%3Ca%20href%3D%27https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fonlinelibrary.wiley.com%5C%2Fdoi%5C%2Fabs%5C%2F10.1002%5C%2Fbewi.202200039%27%3ELanguage%20as%20a%20Specimen%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EBerichte%20Zur%20Wissenschaftsgeschichte%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%2046%2C%20no.%201%20%282023%29%3A%2092%5Cu2013113.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22itemType%22%3A%22journalArticle%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Language%20as%20a%20Specimen%22%2C%22creators%22%3A%5B%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22Floris%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Solleveld%22%7D%5D%2C%22abstractNote%22%3A%22Language%20was%20never%20studied%20by%20linguists%20%28or%20philologists%29%20alone.%20The%20greater%20part%20of%20the%20languages%20of%20the%20world%20was%20first%20known%20in%20the%20West%20through%20the%20reports%20of%20missionaries%2C%20explorers%2C%20and%20colonial%20administrators%2C%20and%20what%20they%20documented%20reflected%20their%20specific%20interests.%20Missionaries%20wrote%20catechisms%2C%20primers%2C%20dictionaries%2C%20and%20Bible%20translations%20%28especially%20Lord%27s%20Prayers%29%3B%20for%20explorers%20and%20administrators%2C%20language%20was%20one%20aspect%20among%20many%20to%20cover%20in%20their%20accounts%20of%20faraway%20regions.%20Peoples%20were%20identified%20by%20their%20language%3B%20toponyms%20served%20for%20geographic%20description%3B%20names%20of%20plants%20and%20animals%20were%20gathered%20together%20with%20specimens%20and%20images%20of%20plants%20and%20animals.%20In%20this%20context%2C%20linguistic%20materials%20were%20equally%20described%20as%20%5Cu201cspecimens.%5Cu201d%20This%20article%20investigates%20the%20various%20ways%20in%20which%20language%20material%20was%20used%20and%20conceived%20of%20as%20a%20specimen%2C%20and%20the%20global%20trajectories%20of%20these%20%5Cu201cspecimens.%5Cu201d%20Especially%20the%20role%20of%20naturalist%20explorers%20deserves%20closer%20attention%20in%20this%20regard.%20What%20they%20did%2C%20throughout%20the%20late%2018th%20and%2019th%20century%2C%20was%20gathering%20language%20material%20as%20one%20kind%20of%20specimen%20among%20others%2C%20Forster%20in%20the%20Pacific%2C%20Humboldt%2C%20Martius%2C%20and%20d%27Orbigny%20in%20South%20America%2C%20and%20Peters%20in%20Mozambique.%20Two%20large-scale%20expeditions%20from%20the%20mid-19th%20century%20stand%20out%20as%20examples%3A%20the%20U.S.%20Exploring%20Expedition%20%281838%5Cu20131842%29%2C%20whose%20collections%20later%20filled%20the%20Smithsonian%20Institution%2C%20and%20the%20Austrian-Hungarian%20Novara%20expedition%20%281857%5Cu20131859%29.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222023%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22en%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%221522-2365%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fonlinelibrary.wiley.com%5C%2Fdoi%5C%2Fabs%5C%2F10.1002%5C%2Fbewi.202200039%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22T8GTQVKD%22%2C%2242Y4CVGJ%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222023-04-20T22%3A35%3A18Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%22Z5XX5PS9%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22lastModifiedByUser%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A3439166%2C%22username%22%3A%22janet.steins%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22%22%2C%22links%22%3A%7B%22alternate%22%3A%7B%22href%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fwww.zotero.org%5C%2Fjanet.steins%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22text%5C%2Fhtml%22%7D%7D%7D%2C%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Stewart%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222023%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A1%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3EStewart%2C%20Ian.%20%5C%22%3Ca%20href%3D%27https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fonlinelibrary.wiley.com%5C%2Fdoi%5C%2Fabs%5C%2F10.1002%5C%2Fbewi.202200036%27%3EJames%20Cowles%20Prichard%20and%20the%20Linguistic%20Foundations%20of%20Ethnology%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EBerichte%20Zur%20Wissenschaftsgeschichte%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%2046%2C%20no.%201%20%282023%29%3A%2076%5Cu201391.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22itemType%22%3A%22journalArticle%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22James%20Cowles%20Prichard%20and%20the%20Linguistic%20Foundations%20of%20Ethnology%22%2C%22creators%22%3A%5B%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22Ian%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Stewart%22%7D%5D%2C%22abstractNote%22%3A%22This%20article%20examines%20the%20English%20scholar%20James%20Cowles%20Prichard%27s%20attention%20to%20language%20and%20comparative%20philology%20within%20his%20wider%20project%20on%20the%20natural%20history%20of%20man.%20It%20reveals%20that%20linguistic%20evidence%20was%20among%20the%20most%20important%20elements%20for%20Prichard%20in%20his%20overarching%20scientific%20aim%20of%20investigating%20human%20physical%20diversity%2C%20and%20served%20as%20the%20evidential%20foundation%20for%20his%20ethnology.%20His%20work%20on%20Celtic%20comparative%20philology%20made%20him%20not%20only%20one%20of%20the%20earliest%20British%20adopters%20of%20German%20comparative%20grammar%2C%20but%20a%20comparative%20philologist%20of%20European%20stature%20in%20his%20own%20right.%20More%20generally%2C%20linguistic%20evidence%20helped%20Prichard%20to%20keep%20his%20magnum%20opus%2C%20Researches%20into%20the%20Physical%20History%20of%20Mankind%2C%20as%20logically%20ordered%20as%20possible%2C%20and%20therefore%20to%20turn%20ethnology%20into%20a%20discipline%20with%20analytical%20aspirations%20on%20a%20global%20scale.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222023%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22en%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%221522-2365%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2 eas%20and%20more%20particularly%20in%20the%20study%20of%20language.%20The%20studies%20combine%20to%20contextualize%20structuralism%20in%20both%20its%20unity%20and%20its%20diversity%2C%20hence%20the%20title.%20In%20the%20first%20section%2C%20the%20reader%20is%20introduced%20to%20the%20broader%20canvas%20of%20disciplines%20and%20competing%20ideas%20surrounding%20structuralism%2C%20starting%20with%20Claude%20L%5Cu00e9vi-Strauss%5Cu2019s%20anthropological%20structuralism.%20The%20second%20section%20views%20structural%20linguistics%20from%20without%20and%20investigates%20its%20legacy%20in%20relation%20to%20contemporary%20linguistics%2C%20analyzing%20its%20relationship%20to%20functionalism%20and%20its%20forerunners.%20The%20third%20section%20explores%20structuralism%20from%20within%2C%20with%20particular%20attention%20to%20a%20specific%20output%3A%20Louis%20Hjelmslev%5Cu2019s%20theory%20of%20glossematics.%20This%20constitutes%20the%20focus%20from%20where%20the%20immediate%20past%20within%20the%20Danish%20tradition%20is%20reanalyzed%20and%20its%20heritage%20for%20today%5Cu2019s%20semiotics%20and%20linguistics%20is%20discussed.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222023%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISBN%22%3A%22978-87-7304-447-6%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fwww.royalacademy.dk%5C%2Fda%5C%2FPublikationer%5C%2FScientia-Danica%5C%2FSeries-H8%5C%2FStructuralism%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22T8GTQVKD%22%2C%2242Y4CVGJ%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222023-04-20T22%3A29%3A09Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%228LFZCNSK%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22lastModifiedByUser%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A325413%2C%22username%22%3A%22agiovine%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22%22%2C%22links%22%3A%7B%22alternate%22%3A%7B%22href%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fwww.zotero.org%5C%2Fagiovine%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22text%5C%2Fhtml%22%7D%7D%7D%2C%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22McElvenny%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222023%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A0%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22 on%20in%20Anthropocene%20scholarship%20and%20collaboratively%20reflect%20on%20how%20we%20want%20to%20situate%20our%20field%20toward%20that%20scholarship.%20It%20will%20involve%20taking%20up%20such%20fundamental%20questions%20as%20why%20and%20how%2C%20as%20well%20as%20for%20and%20with%20whom%2C%20we%20do%20the%20history%20of%20science.%20This%20introduction%20to%20the%20Focus%20section%20%5Cu201cHistory%20of%20Science%20in%20the%20Anthropocene%5Cu201d%20presents%20the%20Anthropocene%20as%20both%20a%20challenge%20and%20an%20opportunity%2C%20opening%20up%20new%20avenues%20of%20research%20and%20widening%20spatial%2C%20temporal%2C%20and%20topical%20boundaries%20while%20giving%20rise%20to%20urgent%20problems%2C%20dilemmas%2C%20and%20choices%20that%20will%20need%20to%20be%20faced.%20The%20aim%20of%20this%20Focus%20section%20is%20to%20put%20these%20challenges%20and%20opportunities%20on%20the%20history%20of%20science%5Cu2019s%20agenda%20and%2C%20thereby%2C%20to%20start%20a%20discipline-wide%20dialogue.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%22%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F719629%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22XP2XI54B%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222022-08-25T04%3A18%3A41Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%22H56TZD4R%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Stark%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A0%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3EStark%2C%20Laura.%20%5C%22%3Ca%20href%3D%27https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F718199%27%3EReservations%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EIsis%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%20113%2C%20no.%201%20%282022%29%3A%20128%5Cu201336.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%2 %20the%20late%20nineteenth%20century%2C%20anthropologists%2C%20linguists%2C%20archaeologists%2C%20and%20other%20chroniclers%20began%20amassing%20Indigenous%20cultural%20objects%5Cu2014crafts%2C%20clothing%2C%20images%2C%20song%20recordings%5Cu2014by%20the%20millions.%20Convinced%20that%20Indigenous%20peoples%20were%20doomed%20to%20disappear%2C%20collectors%20donated%20these%20objects%20to%20museums%20and%20universities%20that%20would%20preserve%20and%20exhibit%20them.%20Samuel%20Redman%20dives%20into%20the%20archive%20to%20understand%20what%20the%20collectors%20deemed%20the%20tradition%20of%20the%20%5Cu201cvanishing%20Indian%5Cu201d%20and%20what%20we%20can%20learn%20from%20the%20complex%20legacy%20of%20salvage%20anthropology.%5Cn%5CnThe%20salvage%20catalog%20betrays%20a%20vision%20of%20Native%20cultures%20clouded%20by%20racist%20assumptions%5Cu2014a%20vision%20that%20had%20lasting%20consequences.%20The%20collecting%20practice%20became%20an%20engine%20of%20the%20American%20museum%20and%20significantly%20shaped%20public%20education%20and%20preservation%2C%20as%20well%20as%20popular%20ideas%20about%20Indigenous%20cultures.%20Prophets%20and%20Ghosts%20teases%20out%20the%20moral%20challenges%20inherent%20in%20the%20salvage%20project.%20Preservationists%20successfully%20maintained%20an%20important%20human%20inheritance%2C%20sometimes%20through%20collaboration%20with%20Indigenous%20people%2C%20but%20collectors%5Cu2019%20methods%20also%20included%20outright%20theft.%20The%20resulting%20portrait%20of%20Indigenous%20culture%20reinforced%20the%20public%5Cu2019s%20confidence%20in%20the%20hierarchies%20of%20superiority%20and%20inferiority%20invented%20by%20%5Cu201cscientific%5Cu201d%20racism.%5Cn%5CnToday%20the%20same%20salvaged%20objects%20are%20sources%20of%20invaluable%20knowledge%20for%20researchers%20and%20museum%20visitors.%20But%20the%20question%20of%20what%20should%20be%20done%20with%20such%20collections%20is%20nonetheless%20urgent.%20Redman%20interviews%20Indigenous%20artists%20and%20curators%2C%20who%20offer%20fresh%20perspectives%20on%20the%20history%20and%20impact%20of%20cultural%20salvage%2C%20pointing%20to%20new%20ideas%20on%20how%20we%20might%20contend%20with%20a%20challenging%20inheritance.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISBN%22%3A%22%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fwww.hup.harvard.edu%5C%2Fcatalog.php%3Fisbn%3D9780674979574%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22XP2XI54B%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222022-08-25T04%3A18%3A51Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%22U2KZZ3NH%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Pe%5Cu0161a%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A0%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3EPe%5Cu0161a%2C%20Iva.%20%5C%22%3Ca%20href%3D%27https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F719630%27%3EA%20Planetary%20Anthropocene%3F%20Views%20From%20Africa%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EIsis%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%20113%2C%20no.%202%20%282022%29%3A%20386%5Cu201395.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22itemType%22%3A%22journalArticle%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22A%20Planetary%20Anthropocene%3F%20Views%20From%20Africa%22%2C%22creators%22%3A%5B%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22Iva%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Pe%5Cu0161a%22%7D%5D%2C%22abstractNote%22%3A%22The%20Anthropocene%20is%20built%20on%20complex%20technological%20systems%20that%20span%20the%20globe.%20Historians%20of%20science%20have%20done%20much%20to%20document%20the%20emergence%20of%20this%20%5Cu201ctechnosphere.%5Cu201d%20Yet%20more%20interdisciplinary%20and%20regionally%20diverse%20approaches%20are%20needed%20to%20understand%20the%20complexity%20and%20unpredictability%20of%20the%20technosphere%20in%20our%20Anthropocene%20times.%20Rather%20than%20assuming%20a%20single%20planetary%20phenomenon%2C%20this%20essay%20emphasizes%20the%20widely%20varied%20lived%20experiences%20of%20the%20Anthropocene.%20Taking%20industrialized%20mining%20and%20oil%20drilling%20as%20examples%20of%20the%20technosphere%2C%20it%20examines%20three%20African%20localities%20of%20resource%20extraction%5Cu2014the%20Congolese%20Copperbelt%2C%20the%20South%20African%20Witwatersrand%2C%20and%20the%20Niger%20Delta%20in%20Nigeria%5Cu2014to%20ask%20why%20the%20environmental%20transformations%20of%20large-scale%20industry%20have%20caused%20violent%20protest%20in%20one%20locality%20but%20apparent%20acquiescence%20in%20others.%20The%20concept%20of%20the%20Anthropocene%20urges%20historians%20of%20science%20to%20connect%20questions%20about%20scientific%20knowledge%20and%20technology%20to%20issues%20of%20environmental%20change%2C%20economic%20organization%2C%20political%20power%2C%20social%20differentiation%2C%20and%20cultural%20imagination.%20This%20broad%20approach%2C%20the%20essay%20suggests%2C%20can%20prove%20extremely%20fruitful%20in%20explaining%20historical%20variations%20and%20contemporary%20responses%20to%20the%20Anthropocene.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%22%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F719630%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22XP2XI54B%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222022-08-26T19%3A55%3A08Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%22522F9ITE%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Renn%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A0%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3ERenn%2C%20J%5Cu00fcrgen.%20%5C%22%3Ca%20href%3D%27https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F719703%27%3EFrom%20the%20History%20of%20Science%20to%20Geoanthropology%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EIsis%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%20113%2C%20no.%202%20%282022%29%3A%20377%5Cu201385.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22itemType%22%3A%22journalArticle%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22From%20the%20History%20of%20Science%20to%20Geoanthropology%22%2C%22creators%22%3A%5B%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22J%5Cu00fcrgen%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Renn%22%7D%5D%2C%22abstractNote%22%3A%22To%20understand%20the%20dynamics%20and%20trajectories%20of%20the%20Anthropocene%2C%20the%20single%20most%20crucial%20parameter%20of%20investigation%20is%20time%5Cu2014specifically%2C%20the%20interconnections%20and%20friction%20between%20multiple%20timescales%20and%20temporal%20processes.%20This%20essay%20outlines%20a%20possible%20role%20for%20the%20history%20of%20science%20in%20understanding%20the%20Anthropocene.%20The%20notion%20of%20the%20%5Cu201cAnthropocene%5Cu201d%20entails%20different%20historical%20horizons%20being%20banded%20together%5Cu2014in%20particular%2C%20longue%20dur%5Cu00e9e%20transformations%20and%20the%20now-accelerating%20environmental%20and%20socio-epistemic%20changes.%20But%20the%20challenge%20of%20the%20Anthropocene%20for%20the%20history%20of%20science%20lies%20not%20only%20in%20new%20questions%2C%20topics%2C%20and%20methodological%20approaches%3A%20the%20history%20of%20science%20itself%20may%20gain%20new%20opportunities%20to%20use%20its%20insights%20and%20reflective%20potential%20to%20encourage%20innovative%20forms%20of%20scientific%20knowledge%20production.%20The%20essay%20argues%20that%20we%20need%20a%20new%20transdisciplinary%2C%20transformative%20science%20in%20order%20to%20understand%20the%20techno%5Cu2013Earth%20System%20from%20an%20integrative%20perspective.%20This%20new%20science%20of%20%5Cu201cgeoanthropology%5Cu201d%20should%20study%20the%20technosphere%20as%20part%20of%20the%20techno%5Cu2013Earth%20System%20by%20integrating%20different%20disciplinary%20perspectives.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%22%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F719703%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22XP2XI54B%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222022-08-25T04%3A25%3A34Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%22J538Z23G%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Brinitzer%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A0%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3EBrinitzer%2C%20Cameron.%20%5C%22%3Ca%20href%3D%27https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F718152%27%3EGenerating%20Fields%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EIsis%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%20113%2C%20no.%201%20%282022%29%3A%20144%5Cu201350.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22itemType%22%3A%22journalArticle%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Generating%20Fields%22%2C%22creators%22%3A%5B%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22Cameron%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Brinitzer%22%7D%5D%2C%22abstractNote%22%3A%22Historians%20of%20the%20field%20sciences%20originally%20advocated%20an%20analytic%20turn%20away%20from%20lab%20sciences%20like%20physics%2C%20arguing%20that%20science%20in%20the%20field%20provided%20richer%20opportunities%20for%20investigating%20scientific%20practices%20than%20science%20conducted%20in%20labs%2C%20while%20advancing%20a%20conceptual%20definition%20of%20fields%20as%20categorically%20opposed%20to%20labs.%20But%20by%20attending%20to%20the%20technical%20use%20of%20an%20electromagnetic%20field%20in%20an%20experimental%20psychology%20lab%20that%20I%20constituted%20as%20a%20field%20for%20my%20own%20research%2C%20I%20revisit%20the%20lab%5Cu2013field%20relation%20in%20light%20of%20this%20layered%20multiplicity%20of%20fields%20in%20the%20lab%2C%20demonstrating%20how%20fields%20are%20always%20generated%5Cu2014whether%20as%20sites%20of%20science%2C%20sources%20of%20epistemic%20authority%2C%20or%20invisible%20physical%20entities%5Cu2014through%20a%20diverse%20range%20of%20social%2C%20conceptual%2C%20technical%2C%20and%20material%20practices.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%22%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F718152%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22XP2XI54B%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222022-08-25T04%3A19%3A03Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%22TVUQ6NTK%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Brinitzer%20and%20Benson%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A0%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3EBrinitzer%2C%20Cameron%2C%20and%20Etienne%20Benson.%20%5C%22%3Ca%20href%3D%27https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F718147%27%3EIntroduction%3A%20What%20Is%20a%20Field%3F%20Transformations%20in%20Fields%2C%20Fieldwork%2C%20and%20Field%20Sciences%20since%20the%20Mid-Twentieth%20Century%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EIsis%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%20113%2C%20no.%201%20%282022%29%3A%20108%5Cu201313.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22itemType%22%3A%22journalArticle%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Introduction%3A%20What%20Is%20a%20Field%3F%20Transformations%20in%20Fields%2C%20Fieldwork%2C%20and%20Field%20Sciences%20since%20the%20Mid-Twentieth%20Century%22%2C%22creators%22%3A%5B%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22Cameron%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Brinitzer%22%7D%2C%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22Etienne%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Benson%22%7D%5D%2C%22abstractNote%22%3A%22In%20recent%20decades%2C%20scholarship%20in%20the%20history%20of%20science%20has%20explored%20the%20emergence%20and%20development%20of%20sciences%20in%20which%20fields%20serve%20as%20privileged%20sites%20of%20knowledge%20production.%20Much%20of%20this%20work%20has%20focused%20on%20the%20field%20sciences%5Cu2019%20formative%20period%20from%20the%20late%20nineteenth%20century%20to%20the%20mid-twentieth%20century%2C%20and%20it%20is%20the%20definitions%20of%20the%20field%2C%20fieldwork%2C%20and%20field%20science%20emerging%20from%20the%20study%20of%20this%20period%20that%20have%20come%20to%20dominate%20the%20historical%20literature.%20Those%20definitions%20cannot%2C%20however%2C%20account%20for%20transformations%20that%20have%20taken%20place%20across%20many%20field%20sciences%20since%20the%20mid-twentieth%20century.%20Examining%20a%20diverse%20set%20of%20disciplines%20and%20contexts%2C%20the%20contributions%20to%20this%20Focus%20section%20reveal%20the%20specific%20conceptual%20and%20material%20contours%20of%20fields%2C%20fieldwork%2C%20and%20field%20sciences%20during%20this%20more%20recent%20period%20and%20suggest%20a%20number%20of%20unanswered%20questions%20and%20topics%20for%20future%20research.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%22%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F718147%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22XP2XI54B%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222022-08-25T04%3A18%3A54Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%22SPXE52S8%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Coen%20and%20Jonsson%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A0%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3ECoen%2C%20Deborah%20R.%20Coen%2C%20and%20Fredrik%20Albritton%20Jonsson.%20%5C%22%3Ca% el%20Structures%3A%20Andr%5Cu00e9%20Leroi-Gourhan%2C%20Claude%20L%5Cu00e9vi-Strauss%2C%20and%20the%20Making%20of%20French%20Structural%20Anthropology%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EHistory%20of%20the%20Human%20Sciences%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%2034%2C%20no.%203%5Cu20134%20%282022%29%3A%20307%5Cu201335.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22itemType%22%3A%22journalArticle%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Parallel%20Structures%3A%20Andr%5Cu00e9%20Leroi-Gourhan%2C%20Claude%20L%5Cu00e9vi-Strauss%2C%20and%20the%20Making%20of%20French%20Structural%20Anthropology%22%2C%22creators%22%3A%5B%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22Jacob%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Collins%22%7D%5D%2C%22abstractNote%22%3A%22This%20article%20reframes%20our%20understanding%20of%20French%20structural%20anthropology%20by%20considering%20the%20work%20of%20Andr%5Cu00e9%20Leroi-Gourhan%20alongside%20that%20of%20Claude%20L%5Cu00e9vi-Strauss.%20These%20two%20anthropologists%20worked%20at%20opposite%20poles%20of%20the%20discipline%2C%20L%5Cu00e9vi-Strauss%20studying%20cultural%20objects%2C%20like%20myths%20and%20kinship%20relations%3B%20Leroi-Gourhan%20looking%20at%20material%20artifacts%2C%20such%20as%20stone%20tools%2C%20bones%2C%20arrowheads%2C%20and%20cave%20paintings.%20In%20spite%20of%20their%20difference%20in%20focus%2C%20these%20thinkers%20shared%20a%20similar%20approach%20to%20the%20interpretation%20of%20their%20sources%3A%20Each%20individual%20object%20was%20meaningful%20only%20as%20part%20of%20a%20larger%20whole.%20For%20L%5Cu00e9vi-Strauss%2C%20structuralism%20was%20designed%20to%20unlock%20features%20of%20the%20human%20mind%3B%20for%20Leroi-Gourhan%2C%20to%20uncover%20the%20material%20processes%20that%20underlay%20human%20life.%20Again%2C%20in%20spite%20of%20their%20difference%20in%20orientation%2C%20both%20structuralisms%20produced%20similar%20theories%20of%20human%20society.%20Whether%20%5Cu2018primitive%5Cu2019%20or%20%5Cu2018advanced%5Cu2019%2C%20all%20societies%20functioned%20the%20same%20way%3A%20Their%20institutions%20worked%20harmoniously%2C%20beyond%20the%20intentions%20of%20any%20individual%20actors%2C%20to%20preserve%20the%20stability%20of%20the%20group.%20This%20eliminated%20the%20basis%20for%20thinking%20one%20society%20was%20superior%20to%20another.%20Finally%2C%20the%20article%20argues%20that%20both%20L%5Cu00e9vi-Strauss%20and%20Leroi-Gourhan%20believed%20that%20structural%20anthropology%20could%20found%20a%20%5Cu2018new%20humanism%5Cu2019%2C%20and%20thereby%20rescue%20modernity%20from%20moral%20degeneration.%20This%20%5Cu2018new%20humanism%5Cu2019%20could%20not%20only%20produce%20a%20universal%20description%20of%20human%20nature%2C%20but%20also%20help%20rethink%20French%20colonialism%2C%20broker%20new%20geopolitical%20alliances%2C%20and%20prevent%20the%20erasure%20of%20world%20cultures.%20Structural%20anthropology%20thus%20imagined%20a%20tight%20relationship%20between%20its%20social-scientific%20work%20and%20its%20political-moral%20mission.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%22%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi.org%5C%2F10.1177%5C%2F0952695120911531%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22XP2XI54B%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222022-08-25T04%3A23%3A57Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%22W52TU3NV%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Germann%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A0%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3EGermann%2C%20Pascal.%20%5C%22%3Ca%20href%3D%27https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi.org%5C%2F10.1177%5C%2F09526951211010385%27%3ERace%20in%20Post-War%20Science%3A%20The%20Swiss%20Case%20in%20a%20Global%20Context%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EHistory%20of%20the%20Human%20Sciences%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%2035%2C%20no.%201%20%282022%29%3A%20216%5Cu201341.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22itemType%22%3A%22journalArticle%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Race%20in%20Post-War%20Science%3A%20The%20Swiss%20Case%20in%20a%20Global%20Context%22%2C%22creators%22%3A%5B%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22Pascal%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Germann%22%7D%5D%2C%22abstractNote%22%3A%22The%20historiography%20on%20the%20concept%20of%20race%20in%20the%20post-war%20sciences%20has%20focused%20predominantly%20on%20the%20UNESCO%20campaign%20against%20scientific%20racism%20and%20on%20the%20Anglo-American%20research%20community.%20By%20way%20of%20contrast%2C%20this%20article%20highlights%20the%20history%20of%20the%20concept%20of%20race%20from%20a%20thus%20far%20unexplored%20angle%3A%20from%20Swiss%20research%20centres%20and%20their%20global%20interconnections%20with%20racial%20researchers%20around%20the%20world.%20The%20article%20investigates%20how%20the%20acceptance%2C%20resonance%2C%20and%20prestige%20of%20racial%20research%20changed%20during%20the%20post-war%20years.%20It%20analyses%20what%20resources%20could%20be%20mobilised%20that%20enabled%20researchers%20to%20carry%20out%20and%20continue%20scientific%20studies%20in%20the%20field%20of%20racial%20research%20or%20even%20to%20expand%20them%20and%20link%20them%20to%20new%20contexts.%20From%20this%20perspective%2C%20the%20article%20looks%20at%20the%20dynamics%2C%20openness%2C%20and%20contingency%20of%20the%20European%20post-war%20period%2C%20which%20was%20less%20stable%2C%20anti-racist%2C%20and%20spiritually%20renewed%20than%20retrospective%20success%20stories%20often%20suggest.%20The%20pronounced%20internationality%20of%20Swiss%20racial%20science%20and%20its%20close%20entanglement%20with%20the%20booming%20field%20of%20human%20genetics%20in%20the%20early%201950s%20point%20to%20the%20ambiguities%20of%20the%20period%5Cu2019s%20political%20and%20scientific%20development.%20I%20argue%20that%20the%20impact%20of%20post-war%20anti-racism%20on%20science%20was%20more%20limited%20than%20is%20frequently%20assumed%3A%20it%20did%20not%20drain%20the%20market%20for%20racial%20knowledge%20on%20a%20continent%20that%20clung%20to%20imperialism%20and%20was%20still%20shaped%20by%20racist%20violence.%20Only%20from%20the%20mid%201950s%20onwards%20did%20a%20series%20of%20unforeseen%20events%20and%20contingent%20shifts%20curtail%20the%20importance%20of%20the%20race%20concept%20in%20various%20sectors%20of%20the%20human%20sciences.%22%2C%22date%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22language%22%3A%22%22%2C%22DOI%22%3A%22%22%2C%22ISSN%22%3A%22%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi.org%5C%2F10.1177%5C%2F09526951211010385%22%2C%22collections%22%3A%5B%22ASGPGW59%22%2C%22XP2XI54B%22%5D%2C%22dateModified%22%3A%222022-08-25T04%3A19%3A08Z%22%7D%7D%2C%7B%22key%22%3A%22XPRA9I62%22%2C%22library%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A756756%7D%2C%22meta%22%3A%7B%22creatorSummary%22%3A%22Helmreich%22%2C%22parsedDate%22%3A%222022%22%2C%22numChildren%22%3A0%7D%2C%22bib%22%3A%22%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-bib-body%5C%22%20style%3D%5C%22line-height%3A%201.35%3B%20padding-left%3A%201em%3B%20text-indent%3A-1em%3B%5C%22%3E%5Cn%20%3Cdiv%20class%3D%5C%22csl-entry%5C%22%3EHelmreich%2C%20Stefan.%20%5C%22%3Ca%20href%3D%27https%3A%5C%2F%5C%2Fdoi-org.libproxy.unm.edu%5C%2F10.1086%5C%2F718148%27%3EFlipping%20the%20Field%3C%5C%2Fa%3E.%5C%22%20%3Ci%3EIsis%3C%5C%2Fi%3E%20113%2C%20no.%201%20%282022%29%3A%20151%5Cu201356.%20%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%5Cn%3C%5C%2Fdiv%3E%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22itemType%22%3A%22journalArticle%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Flipping%20the%20Field%22%2C%22creators%22%3A%5B%7B%22creatorType%22%3A%22author%22%2C%22firstName%22%3A%22Stefan%22%2C%22lastName%22%3A%22Helmreich%22%7D%5D%2C%22abstractNote%22%3A%22The%20FLoating%20Instrument%20Platform%20%28FLIP%29%2C%20a%20seagoing%20vessel%20managed%20by%20the%20Scripps%20Institution%20of%20Oceanography%20in%20La%20Jolla%2C%20California%2C%20offers%20an%20unusual%20vantage%20point%20on%20the%20sea%2C%20one%20useful%20for%20reflec
